page.title: 18Game in the Llangybi area
page.content: The Llangybi Estate lets its shooting rights to a Sporting Syndicate.The tennant keeper puts out to Estate woods ang grounds each year approximately 11 thousand pheasants,a thousand mallard and a thousand partridge. There has been organised shooting in this area for a number of years so the wild pheasant population has built up quite substantially. Most of the mallard in the area,when old enough fly from the small streams and ponds they were originally put on,fly down to Llangybi bottoms and the River Usk.There are also a number of hares in the area,which live on the flat pasture land adjacent to the river. On Several occasions,roe deer have been seen in Llantrisant.They have come down into the area from Wentwood Forest.
